p: The hepatoprotective potential of 12 pure compounds (marrubiin, premarrubiin, vulgarin, luteol, vulgarol, apigenin-7-glucronide, vitexin, apigenin, chryseriol, stachydrine, acetoside, and 1-caffeory-L-malic acid) characteristic for M. vulgare were tested on CCl 4-induced acute liver injury in rats through the in silico method. All compounds showed expected and similar bioactivity, especially when it comes to liver-associated enzymes inhibition [ 17].
